case_vignette: A previously healthy 64-year-old woman comes to the physician because of a dry cough and progressively worsening shortness of breath for the past 2 months. She has not had fever, chills, or night sweats. She has smoked one pack of cigarettes daily for the past 45 years. She appears thin. Examination of the lung shows a prolonged expiratory phase and end-expiratory wheezing. Spirometry shows decreased FEV1:FVC ratio (< 70% predicted), decreased FEV1, and a total lung capacity of 125% of predicted. The diffusion capacity of the lung (DLCO) is decreased.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having a dry cough and my breath gets short easily, and it's been getting worse over the last two months.
Have you had any fever or chest pain?
No, I haven't had any fever or chest pain.
Have you had any difficulty swallowing or coughing up blood?
No, I haven't had difficulty swallowing or coughing up blood.
Have you had any recent travel history or exposure to anyone with a respiratory illness?
No, there's no recent travel or exposure to anyone with a respiratory illness that I'm aware of.
Have you had any allergies or asthma in the past?
I've been healthy in the past, with no allergies or asthma.
Have you had any recent changes in your weight or appetite?
I haven't mentioned anything about my weight or appetite.
Have you had any recent changes in your sleep patterns or energy levels?
No changes in my sleep patterns or energy levels have been mentioned.
Have you had any recent changes in your stress levels or work schedule?
I haven't mentioned anything about changes in my stress levels or work schedule.
Have you had any recent changes in your diet or exercise routine?
I haven't mentioned any changes in my diet or exercise routine.
Have you had any recent changes in your medication or supplements?
I haven't mentioned taking any medications or supplements.
Have you had any recent changes in your family history of respiratory illnesses?
No, I haven't mentioned any family history of respiratory illnesses.
Final Diagnosis: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)
